intro: Symbolanthus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf symbolanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitats.
